questions.answer: Parliamentary benches, committees, and the Government

questions.question: How many signatures are required for a private member's bill in Timor-Leste?

What type of majority is required to pass organic laws in Timor-Leste's Parliament?
What action can the President take after Parliament passes a bill?
choices: Promulgate, veto, or request constitutional review
questions.answer: Promulgate, veto, or request constitutional review

questions.question: Where are new laws published in Timor-Leste after promulgation?
What is one method of parliamentary oversight in Timor-Leste?
How often are parliamentary elections held in Timor-Leste?
What fraction of MPs can initiate a vote of no confidence?
What majority is required to pass a vote of no confidence?
What is the minimum number of candidates of each gender required per every group of 10 candidates on party lists?
Who forms the Parliamentary Bureau?
choices: The President of Parliament, Vice-Presidents, and Secretaries
questions.answer: The President of Parliament, Vice-Presidents, and Secretaries

questions.question: What type of committees can be formed in addition to standing committees?
What is the first stage of the legislative process in Timor-Leste?
What can parliamentary committees do during the review stage of a bill?
What happens during the plenary debate stage of the legislative process?
choices: Only committee members discuss the bill
The full parliament discusses the bill
The President decides on the bill
The public votes on the bill
questions.answer: The full parliament discusses the bill

questions.question: What is the purpose of the general principles debate in the plenary session?
choices: To elect the President of Parliament
To discuss the overall concept and goals of the bill
To amend specific articles of the bill
To vote on the final version of the bill
questions.answer: To discuss the overall concept and goals of the bill

questions.question: What type of questions can MPs submit to ministers as part of parliamentary oversight?
What power do parliamentary committees have in terms of oversight?
choices: They can amend laws without full parliamentary approval
They can summon officials and conduct inquiries
They can appoint new government officials
questions.answer: They can summon officials and conduct inquiries

questions.question: What is the purpose of the vote of no confidence mechanism?
What is one challenge faced by Timor-Leste's National Parliament?
What role does the National Parliament play in Timor-Leste's system of checks and balances?
choices: It acts as a check on executive power
It appoints judges to the Supreme Court
It manages the national budget without oversight
questions.answer: It acts as a check on executive power

questions.question: How does the proportional representation system impact governance in Timor-Leste?
choices: It ensures only two parties are represented
It allows for diverse representation in parliament
It guarantees a majority government every election
It eliminates the need for coalitions
questions.answer: It allows for diverse representation in parliament

questions.question: What is the significance of the parliamentary committee stage in the legislative process?
choices: It bypasses the need for a full parliamentary vote
It allows for more detailed scrutiny of bills
It gives the President direct input on legislation
It eliminates the possibility of amendments
questions.answer: It allows for more detailed scrutiny of bills
